Description: Major version evolution with breaking changes
First agent renamed from DI_Data_Technical_Specification_SN to DI Data Technical Specification SN
Second agent renamed from DI_Delta_Model_Changes_SN to DI Delta Model Changes SN
Third agent renamed from DI_Functional_Test_Cases_SN to DI Functional Test Cases SN
Workflow ID changed from 1594 to 2147
Workflow name changed from DI_DataSpecs_Modelupdates_SN to DI DataSpecs Modelupdates SN
Root structure reorganized from workflowId/workflowName/nodes to workFlowDetail/workflowAgents
Agent structure changed from agentName to name field
Model field changed from model to modelDeploymentName
Model values updated from gpt-4 to gpt-4.1 across all agents
Tools field changed from tools array to toolReferences array
Task structure completely removed and flattened into description field
expectedOutput field completely removed from AAVA 2.0
Agent IDs added in AAVA 2.0 (3885, 3474, 3545)
Tool references changed from string array to empty array structure
Loss of expectedOutput constraints and formatting requirements
Cost estimation sections removed from all agents
Breaking changes require comprehensive migration of dependent systems
Empty toolReferences arrays create ambiguity about tool availability
Consistent description content preserved across versions
Agent count remains consistent at 3 agents
Migration from task-based to flat description structure
GitHub integration instructions removed from agent descriptions
Workflow name field maintains string type but changes casing convention
No syntax errors or broken references in AAVA 1.0
No syntax errors or broken references in AAVA 2.0
